title: Testing Positive For Drugs, Winning The Masters And Now Having An Olympic Shot - Tiger Woods' Life Is A Roller coaster
text:
Tiger Woods was once a household name in golf. In fact when we thought of the sport, he was the man who came to light. And why not? For a majority of his career, he hardly had any equal. But then he was not God, he was but a mortal, albeit an extraordinary one.

Things went awry for him in 2017 when he was arrested for drunk driving. The drama would not end there as he went on to test positive for 5 different types of drugs in his system. It was going from bad to worse.

Reuters

His public image went down, no longer was his name associated with success and it really was not a great feeling to be Tiger Woods at that point. But there was light at the end of the tunnel.

After battling multiple health issues and also drinking itself, Tiger returned to what he did best, playing golf. In 2018 he clinched the Tour Championship after 5 years and suddenly he was the Tiger of old.

Don't Miss 5.9 K SHARES

Reuters

He was not done yet. Tiger took home the Masters in April and the world sat up and took notice. Yes, all of a sudden, he was back in the fray as a contender. His career is star-studded and he has achieved everything he could hope to. Or has he?

The legend has now set himself up for another glittering chapter. Golf returned to the Olympics after 112 years in 2016. But Tiger missed out due to injury. Now he is aiming for a shot at a medal in Tokyo and given the kind of form he's in, there's no reason why he cannot do it.

Reuters

Tiger will come up against top class golfers of the current generation in the qualifiers as he looks to book a ticket for Japan. So in this battle of youth vs experience, who will win? Let's wait and see how things unfold.

With Inputs From Reuters.
